87AEDBA6779D4C4C935FEF7EE7CD7E53.description:
The SkillsUSA Framework is used to pinpoint the Essential Elements found in Personal Skills,
Workplace Skills and Technical Skills Grounded in Academics. Students will be expected to
display or explain how they used some of these Essential Elements. For more, visit:
www.skillsusa.org/who-we-are/skillsusa-framework/

48E7A4688D574758A2B3FD6A6B14CBCA.description: Demonstrate good grooming in personal hygiene

F54E6D2BBF6148EFB776EB8BBEAE368D.description: Display clothing that meets national standards requirement for competition

11719EDAE25D48388772D5287FA8C8CC.description:
Demonstrate a professional appearance in dress, good grooming, and personal
presentation

5F68565EC61C48309E68E92146BE920C.description: Project a professional self-image through attire and grooming

63E8BDE9D180420E948B60A5A875AA86.description: Check for understanding when articulating complex issues

CC3CE5081DD04C588704CC4ECC2D9023.description:
Articulate knowledge and understanding of SkillsUSA framework and how the Personal
Skills, Workplace Skills, and Technical Skills are applicable to successful employment
and career advancement

433FD5B95B10491AA96FC2185874BEE2.description:
Demonstrate personal salesmanship by explaining qualities and experiences that will lead
to professional success

58A237D92A5F49A2A1EE9EBD16E33F3E.description: Respond to four to six questions from the judging panel in a clear and concise manner

26791B02D548470AB59102219A785530.description: Demonstrate knowledge of position applying for and personal history

51E8E12B7019481C917803131F3985C0.description: Complete a job interview that meets industry standards

0511ACF8686D45BEBB19289496FBEDCC.description: Troubleshoot electrical circuits and electrical parts

F330AC46308549FC858FFEEF6BFF02DD.description: Using a DVOM is used to measure voltage, resistance, and current

7F830A39B4734D1F9FA0B7276BB99F79.description:
Explain electrical theory concepts such as Ohm's law, electrical current flow, and
resistance. Identify the basic part of an electrical circuit

F458C705070F4498A60B5406D471D49B.description: Initialize electronic control modules following replacement or battery disconnection

5FA075E0C6D84EE0B8F34DB7606B42F2.description: Identify conditions that necessitate aiming/calibration of ADAS sensors and cameras

0CFD8F787F1347718BB13F5F5C04560E.description: Demonstrate proper use of a scan tool

72DFDFBE89C1413F826BC1FD8B4064DE.description: Identify vehicle electronic parts and systems

F4AE424FD0D2451F918CFB1E9A601462.description:
Demonstrate knowledge and skills required for collision repair diagnostics,
including Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS)

FF5F46791EDF4FA0A165F51329AD1ED2.description: Identify and execute attachment methods required for repair

EF2037EA967B43E0A170942F9A963AF2.description: Identify, measure, and mark sectioning locations

F508302C0B6540E5A39B9825B6ACF6AA.description: Access OEM repair information to determine a repair plan strategy

C3FD67A56653439B8658AF8A5C87BC17.description: Determine the material type and the sectioning or replacement procedures

82D76BABE9C9402594E0F4FE547D2BD9.description:
Identify the different types of misalignments to the vehicle’s structure, steering and
suspension

2307421F2C9B482CAB3B1A555404F558.description:
Measure and analyze structural, steering and suspension misalignment of a
unitized body vehicle

4218206C4F594135BEE1467813A092D0.description:
Using a mechanical measuring system, determine the different types of misalignments
that the vehicle’s lower structure has sustained

89E108A6FD5B45A98B389C32DBC98487.description:
Using a tram gauge and tape measure, measure the damaged vehicle’s upper body and
steering and suspension control points

8E16882274FD41A9A360A67E039EC176.description:
Measure and analyze structural, steering and suspension misalignment of a body
on frame vehicle using a tram gauge measuring system

D7DAE7E3D1F84678B3BB52BD431BA7E0.description:
Identify the extent of damage, the direction of impact, and direction of correction,
document the methods and sequence of repair

4E7B7040F7094FD08E71AD59D154A1C0.description: Identify anchoring and blocking locations for structural realignment

A5751497DE254C1FBE14E0DC327297F0.description: Demonstrate knowledge of vehicle structural realignment

E8AA44F3056740FEB036212D46339823.description: Identify structural damage types and corrections

DE6018855469471498AA50736616F464.description:
Identify and analyze misaligned or damaged steering, suspension, and powertrain
components that can cause vibration, steering, and wheel alignment problems

B0D7BEE50CA64506ADF488F7A3F12527.description: Demonstrate knowledge of steering and suspension geometry

B9CA2902B63D40E7AB358E8FBB59BBB7.description: Identify the illustrated steering and suspension components.

5F9FD3DFC6D64285A45E73B1D1C271C2.description: Demonstrate knowledge of basic steering and suspension parts

9DD4164043094EDB8958FE0BF44E2304.description: Demonstrate proper finish sanding technique to prepare the repair area for application of cosmetic filler

CBC5C1ADAEB64B2999C0743072814D7B.description: Demonstrate proper attention to cooling the welded area before finish sanding the plastic vehicle part

1ADDFABF4D4840F4A2C0598B796C7740.description: Demonstrate proper nitrogen plastic welding technique to the cosmetic side of the plastic vehicle part

0FEA462FA3964F619CAC3CB821F1A4AE.description: Demonstrate the V-grooving of the tear on the cosmetic side of the repair to the proper depth and width

30838D8692C144DDAA604882ECB88497.description: Demonstrate proper nitrogen welding technique on the backside of the plastic vehicle part. Reinforce if desired at the edge to ensure the integrity of the repair

EB4CE59027474041914CBCD19EAE1F34.description: Demonstrate proper fixturing of tear with aluminum tape

BBCF0093A88F4B638301316F1BC6288E.description:
Demonstrate proper backside surface preparation for plastic welding (e.g., grinding V-
groove or abrading surface)

6E03CCB7A85D4CFD8FD4A03DB6D21382.description: Demonstrate proper cleaning of the surface

6AD0167D12874F7193A2550651F8765D.description: Model proper safety procedures during the preparation and welding process

152B0F3E12504D90A54198FE7AB1F72A.description: Complete a tear repair on a plastic vehicle part using a plastic nitrogen welder

5336F18C422B4826A3673EFEE13C681C.description:
Demonstrate the best practice of reapplying adhesion promoter after the final sanding
step, to assure paint adhesion

FD2095FEDE7F4AB48F9B1F1F5DE20E21.description: Finish sanding the repair and surrounding area with 320-grit abrasive to prepare for painting process

1F06FAB65AE24978B61736E89FFAAB98.description: Demonstrate the ability to use 180-grit abrasive to successfully level the repair material and feather into the surrounding area

E3BA3173C96C426D950CD1D059B60700.description:
Demonstrate the ability to use an 80-grit abrasive to “knock down” the bulk of the excess
cosmetic repair material without abrading the surrounding plastic, which would leave “fuzzies”

ADBD24B0502E4886BBCD59799356EF4C.description: Demonstrate the ability to use 50-grit abrasive on a high-speed grinder to rough shape the formed tab, followed by 180-grit on a DA to finely shape the tab, and lastly, a 320-grit abrasive to prepare the featheredge for the painting process

4ADDA6DAF2AE482A89BA07ADA6A75985.description: Demonstrate test to determine readiness to sand (check with fingernail, see if it leaves a white mark in the adhesive)

BD49F33FD3D144688C329178210451A3.description: Demonstrate proper “molding” techniques using contour sheeting and form a new tab

9E089D42B5954F65BEFF5B8E4E3C43DD.description: Demonstrate the ability to load, open and equalize the cartridge; attach the mixing nozzle; and discard the first pump of material

EEE4DE1A60404BA9811C1D59055B95FE.description: Apply a light coating of adhesion promoter and allow it to dry adequately

84B6D634CE784C789084E8D032B23551.description: Demonstrate an understanding of appropriate abrasive grade sequence for tab repair (typically 50 and 80)

C1ABB00F961041E4B6F76ED40A7836B0.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the importance of cleaning before making any repair

C25AF7DA5BD04AE5A51992AE8823D15C.description: Complete a tab repair on plastic vehicle part

567162B451D64EB9A7FCA086C1C6B8B8.description: Demonstrate test to determine readiness to sand (check with fingernail, see if it leaves a white mark in the adhesive)

BA37128CAAA2486BA3CA40F34077F351.description: Demonstrate proper spreading techniques: Apply a thin, tight coat of material; build in thin layers; and avoid air entrapment as they build slightly higher than the surrounding areas

BAB6189D9EAB435D9CE9668B7F649D90.description: Demonstrate the ability to load, open and equalize the cartridge, attach the mixing nozzle, and discard the first pump of material

4A71869CCF6449FF999CB3C9035906E9.description: Apply a light coating of adhesion promoter and allow it to dry adequately

2B444A816285482DA1093448A00914E5.description: Demonstrate understanding of the difference between “Veeing Out” a repair (incorrect) and “Dishing Out” a repair (correct) and how that relates to the finished product (no ghost lines)

97C590578BFD4010915374E7A0C6CC4D.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the need to keep very coarse grade scratches (80 grit) inside valley of repair and not on surrounding plastic, to avoid creating “fuzzies” that will be difficult to conceal within the finished paint work

0C74EADE500F44D595AB6F59A7A9F208.description: Demonstrate an understanding of appropriate abrasive grade sequence for plastic repair (Typically 50, 80, adhesive application, 80, 180, 320)

27BFF6093AAD4238A7D0A46D5D8D168B.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the importance of cleaning before making any repair

1925D58CCB5E490FA46C9A62464509CD.description: Complete a front-side cosmetic surface repair on a plastic vehicle part

D24E7411B5634710A4A2EDD1DABD43DE.description: Demonstrate proper spreading techniques: Apply a thin, tight coat of material, then build a thin layer of adhesive followed by reinforcing mesh and an additional layer of adhesive

FA5E1C4380F745BE9FB998996CBFA409.description: Demonstrate the ability to open, load, and equalize the cartridge, attach the mixing nozzle, and discard the first pump of material

1B6812C723804F8AAE0AB502538D8FA9.description: Apply a light coating of adhesion promoter and allow it to dry adequately

722197D228494E2D9D639DBDF2A715B3.description: Demonstrate an understanding of appropriate abrasive grade sequence for reinforcing plastic repair (typically 50 and 80)

2EEF3BF7F54A4D739629AF704581F866.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the importance to clean before making any repair

5E64D161E63A494E9283760CD7EBEB60.description: Complete a two-sided repair on a plastic vehicle part. Mix and apply appropriate plastic repair material following product maker procedures

ABDAFC4CFE2F41898AD6759291428B6F.description: Identify, remove, and install blind rivets

69E25208DA054FFFB453793BC9660B71.description: Identify, remove, and install self-piercing rivets (SPR)

9A904FA62EEE42929BC172E483623515.description: Make MIG brazing joints using steel coupons

E70B56FF0DED4BF99A20E5F9BC457B5D.description: Make a squeeze-type resistance spot weld (STRSW) using steel coupons

418E755A368B4C6EB2902EB849CAA62B.description: Make a fillet weld on lap using aluminum coupons in the vertical and/or overhead positions using a GMA (MIG) welder

7023565DE1D54E5BA4CE40F2DBAAEE6B.description: Make a butt joint with backing weld using aluminum coupons in the vertical and/or overhead positions using a GMA (MIG) welder

BCF3B7FDFD804EF290E2865532BA88EA.description: Make a plug weld using aluminum coupons in the vertical and/or overhead positions using a GMA (MIG) welder

259068186BDF4358A471F4FE6965F019.description: Make a fillet weld on lap using steel coupons in the vertical and/or overhead positions using a GMA (MIG) welder

35487A2DDDAA4BAE90084DD102846499.description: Make a butt joint with backing weld using steel coupons in the vertical and/or overhead positions using a GMA (MIG) welder.

2E56E73B130843F6B9F23ECC9453A5EC.description: Make a plug weld using steel coupons in the vertical and/or overhead positions using a GMA (MIG) welder

0F70199131E347FEB92E02691CDA8926.description: Demonstrate the understanding and skills necessary for attachment methods needed for collision repair of steel and aluminum panels

DE7023539985472C8C4E065C90EFBD92.description: Clean contaminants from a damaged panel

84D9B93522DF42A5AF629C61B486EAF2.description: Locate surface irregularities on a damaged panel

0B858B9211A144D982EF2BB01C1CF4B1.description: Clean contaminants from a damaged panel

595AE7C49DDF40BB95E7385CB9946DE7.description: Repair depressed area(s) on a steel panel with glue pulling equipment and techniques

866C85B02F1043849FA11328B99F413C.description: Demonstrate various uses of the metal finishing tools

022BFA32A04149A29E907D8C7728FA49.description: Remove finish from the damaged area(s) as necessary

8B797BA49A1242F5B60DBF3901903EA7.description: Locate surface irregularities on a damaged panel

85C7E85477D64EF2B88952143A9BA2FF.description: Clean contaminants from a damaged panel

CF21412BFD7243308B4A9D1FC3BD28EB.description: Repair depressed areas using metal finishing techniques on a steel panel

44E9EBA564E74FB0AF8E83DCFC450712.description: Demonstrate the straightening process, with heat application as necessary

0E9C3EABEB194BAE944104F46FCC499F.description: Remove finish from the damaged area(s) as necessary

B7F08C70F5A7466D9B9C8CE571235B27.description: Locate surface irregularities on a damaged panel

319618FA5643403C9FAC3E804D2EA12A.description: Clean contaminants from a damaged panel
